issue.title: dvdgayonline is sourcing video dood.re which is forcing me to remove my adguard Adblocker

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

Adguard 4.4.5

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://dvdgayonline.com/movies/ノンケ限界面接-the-12th-time/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment> Hi so I was visiting a website I found called gaydvdonline and I selected a video to watch which is sourcing the content directly from a second site called dood.re? And it’s telling me the publisher of the video does not allow adblockers is there anyway this could be resolved please?


3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![DE1D8BD2-52D1-44C5-8E26-CF8003F5EE88](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/124982114/226521991-577c00df-059a-47a3-a14a-b5e47b99d135.png)

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> Please try these rules:
> 
> ```
> @@||pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js$domain=dvdgayonline.com
> @@||dvdgayonline.com^$generichide
> ```

I know what I did wrong I add those two rules as one I resolved the issue adding them separately and now it’s working thank you!

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. The _`/index.php?main_page=product_info&cpath=$document`_ and _`/index.php?main_page=product_info&cPath=$document`_ "malware/phishing" filter blocks legit websites. It's just URL part of certain shop systems.


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: Google invaild search result

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Dangerous site

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Many websites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

In Google search result with a Korean language query, there are some spam websites that its domain is changed frequently.


It seems that importing the following rules is best idea.

```adblock
/^https:\/\/[A-z0-9\.]*[A-z0-9]+\.[A-z]+\/\?u=[A-z0-9]{7}&o=[A-z0-9]{7}/$document
/^https:\/\/[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\/[A-z]+-robot\/\?pl=[A-z0-9-]{22}&sm=[A-z]+-robot&hash=[A-z0-9-]{22}&exp=[0-9]{10}/$document
/^https:\/\/[0-9]{9}\.[A-z0-9-]+\.[A-z]{2}\/[0-9]{6}\.html$/$document
```

Related issues:
 - https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues/598
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139667

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g1154792-d8528472-r880785348-Florentina_s_Trattoria-Mudjimba_Sunshine_Coast_Queensland.html#REVIEWS](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tripadvisor.com%2FShowUserReviews-g1154792-d8528472-r880785348-Florentina_s_Trattoria-Mudjimba_Sunshine_Coast_Queensland.html%23REVIEWS) ### Comment Username: @jslawler > Tapping the banner does nothing, it seems to only serve as an annoyance when scrolling the page. > > As Trip Advisor does not have a paid component, I can only presume it’s meant to be for logging in, which doesn’t seem to work from that banner. > > AdGuard element blocking picker used the following rule to block it successfully: tripadvisor.com###singletonRoot > div.SuwMt.D.Gi.l.ZkqhQ.B1.Z.BB.Cj.Za ### Screenshots
